Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the length of time since Hillary Clinton held a press conference by stating it has been 269 days (or 270 days on publication day) without providing any context or comparison to other candidates.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence or context to determine the significance of the length of time without a press conference.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that holding a press conference is the only way for a candidate to make themselves available to the press, disregarding other forms of media interaction.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why Clinton may not have held a press conference, such as scheduling conflicts or campaign strategy.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the Clinton campaign's argument that Clinton has made herself available to the press in ways equivalent to press conferences, suggesting that she has not given a press conference.
